section_title: A.4 Influence of Number of Message-passing and Diffusion Steps
section_purpose: To report experimental findings on how varying the number of message-passing steps and diffusion steps impacts model performance, noting that increasing these steps beyond a certain threshold does not yield further improvements.
key_points: Evaluations are reported with fixed diffusion steps and varying message-passing steps (Table 10) and vice versa (Table 9).
Increasing the number of iterative steps (either message-passing or diffusion) does not always lead to performance benefits.
When one type of step is fixed, increasing the other beyond a certain threshold does not improve performance.

hyperparameters.message_passing_steps: varied (specific values not given, referenced in tables)
hyperparameters.diffusion_steps: varied (specific values not given, referenced in tables)

reproducibility_notes: Specific values for message-passing and diffusion steps from Tables 9 and 10 are required.
Observation of thresholds beyond which increasing steps does not help should be considered when tuning.
